intro: Vallaris, commonly known as sweet vernal grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the禾本科 (Poaceae) family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, bright yellow to orange inflorescences. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. Vallaris is often found in temperate regions across Europe, Asia, and North America. Its flowers are pollinated by wind, and it plays a role in soil stabilization and as a food source for various insects.
